activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#13289
activity.text:
Hey I'd like to take this issue and work on a fix.

Planned approach:
- Add a maxLength of 2 for the Day and Month inputs, and 4 for the Year input.
- Use `useRef ` to auto-focus the next input once the max length is reached.
- Ensure accessibility and validation are handled properly.

Please assign this to me. Thanks!

ETA: 4 hours

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#13284
activity.text: @Denyme24 I think it should be aligned like this, so it will be more better for desktop/mobile view for tab/laptop/desktop it will be like this: for mobile screen: For achiving this, i modifed the layout structure and added some Tailwind classes: Added to container divs: - flex flex-col md:flex-row - Stacks vertically on mobile, horizontal on tablet+ - md:items-center - Vertically centers items on larger screens - gap-3/gap-4 - Consistent spacing system Edit button group: - flex items-center gap-3 - Groups status badge + edit button with spacing - Changed icon spacing from mr-2 size-4 → gap-1 size-3 for tighter alignment If this all is okay @Jacobjeevan then i can work on this solution ETA: 1 hour

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#13228
activity.text: @GSMPRANEETH Please let me do this or i already done this. check image I've implemented the missing Cypress test case for invalid login scenarios. This was achieved by mocking the backend login API (/api/v1/auth/login/) using cy.intercept, allowing us to simulate a 401 response for invalid credentials, even though the actual backend/frontend validation wasn't yet finalized. Covered test cases: Submission with empty fields (form validation errors) Login with invalid credentials Login attempt with leading/trailing spaces in username and password Using API mocking helped us move forward and ensure the test logic works independently of the current backend state. This issue can now be closed., if i can raise PR (Please allow me to take this)
